title: Gregory the Illuminator
summary: Gregory the Illuminator[1] (Classical Armenian: Գրիգոր Լուսաւորիչ, reformed: Գրիգոր Լուսավորիչ, Grigor Lusavorich;[lower-alpha 1] c. 257 – c. 331) is the patron saint and first official head of the Armenian Apostolic Church. He was a religious leader who converted Armenia from paganism to Christianity in 301.
